definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Witwithout learning is like a tree without fruit.
sentences.chinese: 僅無機智而無學富五車，猶如一棵大樹不結果。

sentences.english: Waist of a straight hair, and the five car-fu school.
sentences.chinese: 一頭齊腰的直髮，而且學富五車。

sentences.english: Fortunately, you don't have to be particularly intelligent or well educated to think independently.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，獨立思考並不需要智力超羣或學富五車。

sentences.english: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.
sentences.chinese: 學富五車，卻惟獨不知如何生活。

sentences.english: The professor is a woman of great scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 該教授是一位學富五車的女性。

definition: full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
